questions.text: A patient recovering from a traumatic injury to the face now finds himself unable to chew his food. On physical examination, his jaw deviates to the right side. The nerve that has been injured in this patient exits the skull through which of the following foramina?

A 43-year-old male received a deep intramuscular injection two days ago and now presents with difficulty walking. You note that his right hip drops every time he raises his right foot. At which location did this patient most likely receive his injection?
questions.correct_answer: A. Superomedial quadrant of the buttock

A 38-year-old man had his most recent episode of schizophrenic relapse 6 months ago. Though he responded well to antipsychotics he still hears occasional voices. Currently he has lost sleep, appetite, and weight and complains of low energy and pervasive anhedonia with low mood. This description best fits which of the following diagnosis?
Which of the following is the most important diagnostic information that differentiates bipolar disorder from schizophrenia?

A 17-year-old patient has recurrent intrusive thoughts which he perceives to be senseless and involuntary. He starts believing these thoughts are being inserted by his family members though these are his own thoughts. Which of the following diagnoses must be considered apart from OCD?
Which one of the following features during trauma has the capacity to predict future development of PTSD?
Which of the following is feature of schizoid personality disorder?
questions.correct_answer: C. Indifference to praise or criticism

questions.text: A pregnant female was taking indomethacin thrice daily till 35 week of gestation. Which anomaly would be expected in baby if delivered now
questions.correct_answer: B. Premature closure of ductus arteriosus

questions.text: Which is the correct statement regarding Fuch’s Endothelial dystrophy:

options.label: A
options.text: It is the most common corneal dystrophy to require keratoplasty

options.label: B
options.text: It shows peripheral cornea guttatae of descements membrane

options.label: C
options.text: It has its primary defect, an epithelial abnormality

options.label: D

questions.correct_answer: A. It is the most common corneal dystrophy to require keratoplasty

questions.text: A patient has an anterior chamber intraocular lens placed into the eye after a complicated phacoemulsification procedure, 3 months later the Uveitis-glaucoma-hyphema (UGH) syndrome results. All of the following except one may be found as part of the syndrome.

options.label: A
options.text: Death of retinal capillary endothelial cells.

options.label: B
options.text: Budding of new capillaries from venules

options.label: E
options.text: Proliferation of retinal capillary endothelial cells.

questions.correct_answer: C. Apoptosis of retinal capillary pericytes

Which statement is NOT true about tetralogy of fallot?

options.label: A
options.text: Associated cardiac anomalies occur in approximately 40 percent of patient with TOF

options.label: B
options.text: Approximately 25 percent of patients have a right aortic arch. This is particularly important to identify if one is contemplating a palliative shunt.

options.label: C
options.text: Abnormalities of the coronary arteries, such as the left anterior descending arising from the right coronary arteries, such as the left anterior descending arising from the right coronary artery, are seen in approximately 10 percent of patients

options.label: D
options.text: TOF is not usually present with associated syndromes

questions.correct_answer: D. TOF is not usually present with associated syndromes

questions.text: Which statement about murmur of TOF is not true:

options.label: A
options.text: The murmur in TOF is due primarily to the right ventricular outflow obstruction, not the VSD

options.label: B
options.text: The murmur is typically a systolic, crescendo-decrescendo murmur with a harsh ejection quality; it is appreciated best along the left mid to upper sterna border with radiation posteriorly.

options.label: C
options.text: The murmur is due both to the degree of obstruction and to the amount of flow across the obstruction.

options.label: D
options.text: During severe hypercyanotic (“tet”) spells, the murmur may actually increase due to the markedly diminished flow across the obstruction.

questions.correct_answer: D. During severe hypercyanotic (“tet”) spells, the murmur may actually increase due to the markedly diminished flow across the obstruction.

questions.text: Which of the following is not used in resistant Kawasaki disease?

A previously healthy 5-year-old boy has a 1-day history of low-grade fever, colicky abdominal pain, and a rash. He is well appearing and alert. His vital signs, other than temperature of 38°C (100.5°F), are completely normal. A diffuse, erythematous, maculopapular, and petechial rash is present on his buttocks and lower extremities, as shown in the photograph. He has no localized abdominal tenderness or rebound; bowel sounds are active. Laboratory data demonstrate Urinalysis: 30 red blood cells (RBCs) per high-powered field, 2+ protein stool: Guaiac positive Platelet count: 135,000/uL These findings are most consistent with which of the following?
The above patient’s skin biopsy and immunoflouroscence of kidney biopsy images are shown below. The immune deposits in kidney of this child are seen in

A previously healthy 2-year-old girl is seen in the emergency department in October with a 3-day history of clear nasal drainage, a 1-day history of respiratory distress, and a barking cough. The parents report that some of the girl’s classmates have had a similar illness in the past few weeks. The girl is febrile (38°C) with a heart rate of 131 beats/min, respiratory rate of 24 breaths/min, and oxygen saturation of 92% on room air. She has clear nasal drainage and inspiratory stridor. The rest of the physical examination findings are normal. A neck radiograph is shown Of the following, the MOST likely pathogen causing her illness is
Recurrent pneumonia is defined as

options.label: A
options.text: 2 or more episodes in a single year or 3 or more, ever with radiological clearing in between

options.label: B
options.text: 3 or more episodes in a single year or 4 or more, ever with radiological clearing in between

options.label: C
options.text: 4 or more episodes in a single year or 6 or more, ever with radiological clearing in between

options.label: D
options.text: 2 or more episodes in a single year or 3 or more, ever with no radiological clearing in between

questions.correct_answer: A. 2 or more episodes in a single year or 3 or more, ever with radiological clearing in between

questions.text: Mother of a 2-month-old boy complains that the boy is having a salty sweat you start suspecting a genetic disease which of the following is not associated with the disease?

options.label: D
options.text: T cell variant of hairy cell leukaemia

questions.correct_answer: D. T cell variant of hairy cell leukaemia

questions.text: A 10-year-old child is having diarrhoea for 2 years, a biopsy suspicious of celiac disease, a peripheral blood smear examination shows dimorphic anemia. Which of the following deficiency is the most likely cause for such blood picture?

A patient presents with easy fatigue for last 1-year general physical examination is unremarkable except for a solitary cervical lymph node. Biopsy from the lymph node shows effaced architecture by monomorphic cells which were positive for CD 20, CD 22, CD79a, negative for CD5 , CD10 and CD23 . Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 10-year-old boy presents with bleeding per rectum, colonoscopy shows a polyp, biopsy from the same shows mature glands smooth muscle and connective tissue admixed together. Which of the following is most appropriate finding of histological description?
Which of the following is a function of inflammasome?
Gross examination of a spleen in a patient who died of complications of rheumatoid arthritis is as follows. Which of the following is most likely the diagnosis?

A patient with thalassemia who has received multiple blood transfusions till date is found to have increased incidence of fever in the last few transfusions. Which of the following is the best way to reduce fever in subsequent transfusions?

Patient presents with weight loss, now he is presented to you with having mental confusion for a few days, an episode of seizure and delirium. Blood examination shows serum sodium 110 mEq/litre, Calcium 9 mg/dl. You start suspecting the manifestations are secondary to a tumour which of the following is most likely diagnosis?

A 15-year-old boy presents with a bony tumor in a flat bone. Histological examination shows Homer Wright Rosette as shown below, tumor cells are positive for CD 99 which of the following is likely diagnosis?
C3 Nephritic factor is

options.label: C

questions.text: A 55-year farmer presents with weight loss, jaundice. Imaging shows a tumor in the liver. His work description was harvesting the food grains storage, transport and sale of the same. You start suspecting a carcinogen exposure during his occupation. Which of the following is most likely to cause?

A 55-year male patient a known case of RHD had untreated aortic regurgitation for past 5 years dies. The gross examination of his heart (right image) and a comparable normal heart (left image) are as shown. The weight of the patient’s heart is 600 g. which of the following is most likely diagnosis?
A 5-year child presents with abdominal mass. Resection of the mass is as shown in the image. what is the likely diagnosis?
Histological examination of a thyroid mass is as shown in the image. what is the likely diagnosis?
For the purpose of interventional trial, the preferred randomization unit is an individual for all the following except:
Fasting blood sugar (FBS) of a population is known to be normally distributed, with a mean of 105 mg% and SD of 10 mg%. Thus 95% of the population will have FBS within:
Estimate mean haemoglobin of 100 women is 10g%. SD is 1 gm%. Standard error of estimate will be:

You work in an ambulatory clinic. You want to identify each of your patients who might have had an acute pulmonary embolism (PE). Therefore, you use a clinical probability assessment tool as part of your diagnostic algorithm for patients with suspected PE. With this assessment tool, if the responses to all questions are negative, the estimated prevalence of PE is only 10%. You also know that a D-dimer enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) has a sensitivity of 95% and a specificity of 50% for the diagnosis of PE in an ambulatory care setting. If you used this ELISA D-dimer test as part of your algorithm to clarify the diagnosis in this low-prevalence group, what percentage of that group who test positive would actually have a confirmed PE?

A well-done randomized trial evaluated the efficacy of full-dose subcutaneous low-molecular-weight heparin (LMWH) versus warfarin (international normalized ratio [INR], 2.0-3.0) in reducing recurrent venous thromboembolism (VTE) in a group of patients with VTE and active cancer. The study duration was 6months. During that time, 17% of the cancer patients receiving warfarin had recurrent VTE compared with 9% of patients receiving full-dose subcutaneous LMWH. On the basis of this information, how many patients need to be treated for 6 months with subcutaneous LMWH to prevent one additional VTE?

A 55-year-old man comes into the urgent care clinic at your medical facility with a hand laceration. He accidentally cut his finger with a kitchen knife while preparing to slice vegetables. He has a 1.5-cm laceration on the palmar surface of his left middle finger, overlying the proximal phalanx. Flexor tendon and vascular structures are intact. He has no record of prior tetanus vaccinations but believes that he probably had “baby shots” because his mother was a nurse. He served in the army and recalls getting many vaccinations while in basic training. He cannot recall getting any vaccinations since leaving military service. You clean and suture the laceration. Which of the following do you recommend for tetanus prophylaxis?

options.label: A
options.text: No tetanus prophylaxis because this is a clean, minor wound

questions.text: The fasting blood glucose levels of a hypothetical population form two overlapping distributions, one of the people with diabetes (B) and another people with no diabetes (A). A test was done and the cutoff was designed to be 120mg/dl. What does area “C” represent in the given image?

options.label: A
options.text: Diabetics correctly classified as the same.

options.label: B
options.text: Non diabetics correctly classified as the same

options.label: C
options.text: Non diabetics incorrectly classified as diabetics

questions.correct_answer: D. Diabetics incorrectly classified as diabetics

questions.text: A farmer brought his 16-month-old child to the OPD for routine immunization. He has been adequately immunized until now. He has already received a measles vaccine during an SIA drive (supplementary immunization activity) a few months back. What will you administer now?

options.label: A
options.text: OPV booster, DPT booster and Vitamin A

options.label: B
options.text: OPV Booster, DPT booster, MR, JE and Vitamin A

options.label: C
options.text: OPV booster, DPT booster, JE vaccine and Vitamin A

options.label: D
options.text: OPV Booster, DPT booster, MR and Vitamin A

questions.correct_answer: B. OPV Booster, DPT booster, MR, JE and Vitamin A

questions.text: Case acts as its own control in which of the following study?

An investigator is designing a randomized, double-blind, placebo controlled clinical trial to see whether vitamin E will prevent lung cancer. Which is most likely to affect the validity (source of bias) of the study?

options.label: B
options.text: Prevalence of smoking in the source population

Regarding postcholecystectomy bile duct injuries, which of the following statements is not true?

options.label: A
options.text: Incidence of open cholecystectomy is in the range of 0.1 to 0.2%

options.label: B
options.text: Incidence rate following laparoscopic cholecystectomy is higher

options.label: C
options.text: Strasberg type A injury is the commonest.

options.label: D

questions.correct_answer: D. Use of Hasson’s cannula has decreased the incidence of bile duct injuries

questions.text: A patient of DVT of left lower limb presents with the following picture Which of the following statement is true regarding this

options.label: A
options.text: Obliteration of the major deep venous channels of the leg

options.label: B
options.text: Obliteration of the collateral veins of the leg

options.label: C
options.text: Obliteration of the major deep venous channels and the collateral veins of the leg

questions.correct_answer: C. Obliteration of the major deep venous channels and the collateral veins of the leg

questions.text: A 24-French (Fr) Foley balloon catheter:

options.text: Can hold 24 mL of fluid in the retainment balloon

questions.correct_answer: B. Measures 8 mm in outer diameter.

questions.text: Which of the following is an absolute contraindication for bariatric surgery?

A 55-year-old man with a several-month history of hemoccult positive stools has recently been diagnosed with gastric cancer by upper endoscopy. Staging CT demonstrates no evidence of intra-abdominal disease. You recommend a staging laparoscopy before definitive resection because:

options.label: A
options.text: CT has a high false-negative rate in the staging of most cancers.

options.label: B
options.text: Carcinomatosis and peritoneal seeding are more accurately diagnosed with laparoscopy

options.label: C
options.text: Nontherapeutic laparotomies can be avoided in more than 20% of patients after staging laparoscopy.

questions.text: What is the best diagnostic tool to diagnose epiphrenic diverticulum?

A 40-year-old woman presents with weight loss, night sweats, and a 2-cm left neck mass. She is found to have an elevated LDH of 800. Imaging reveals extensive cervical, mediastinal, and abdominal adenopathy. You suspect lymphoma and schedule a biopsy of the neck mass for histologic diagnosis. Which of the following would be the most appropriate technique to obtain tissue for diagnosis?

A 56-year-old woman presents to her primary care physician with leftsided facial swelling and facial drooping. The patient has weakness of the lower portion of her facial nerve and a palpable parotid mass. A biopsy is performed showing a high-grade mucoepidermoid carcinoma. There are no palpable neck lymph nodes. What is the best treatment for this patient?
questions.correct_answer: D. Surgery followed by adjuvant radiation

questions.text: All of the following statements are true about repair of groin hernias except:

options.label: A
options.text: Lichtenstein tension free repair has a low recurrence rate

options.label: B
options.text: TEP repair is an extraperitoneal approach to laparoscopic repair of groin hernia

options.label: C
options.text: In Shouldice repair, non-absorbable mesh is used

options.label: D
options.text: The surgery can be done under local anesthesia in selected cases

questions.correct_answer: C. In Shouldice repair, non-absorbable mesh is used

questions.text: Triangle of Doom is bounded by all of the following except:
Which of the following statements regarding the order or description of the zones of burn injury is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: A zone of hyperemia inside a zone of stasis

options.label: B
options.text: A zone of hyperemia superficial to a zone of stasis, with a deeper zone of coagulation beneath

options.label: C
options.text: A zone of coagulation at the surface of a burn wound, a zone of stasis within the injured dermal layer, and a deep zone of hyperemia characterized by vasodilated subcutaneous vessels

options.label: D
options.text: A zone of coagulation, surrounded by a zone of stasis, which is surrounded by a zone of hyperemia

questions.correct_answer: D. A zone of coagulation, surrounded by a zone of stasis, which is surrounded by a zone of hyperemia

questions.text: In seminoma stage IIA , standard treatment is?
questions.correct_answer: B. Radiotherapy to retroperitoneal lymph nodes

questions.text: A 72-year-old man undergoes an aortobifemoral graft for symptomatic aortoiliac occlusive disease. The inferior mesenteric artery (IMA) is ligated at its aortic attachment. Twenty-four hours after surgery the patient has abdominal distention, fever, and bloody diarrhea. Which of the following is the most appropriate diagnostic study for this patient?
Varicose veins of size less than _____ can be best treated by sclerotherapy:

A 51-year-old woman presents with dull anterior chest pain. She is a lifelong nonsmoker. Her medical history is significant for Hashimoto’s thyroiditis, for which she has been taking levothyroxine for 1 year. Examination is unremarkable. Laboratory studies show normal blood counts, lactate dehydrogenase (LDH), -fetoprotein, and beta-human chorionic gonadotropin (-hCG). Chest radiograph reveals clear lung fields with a retrosternal density. Computed tomography (CT) scan shows a 4-cm, smooth, anterior mediastinal mass. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Hamman’s sign is seen in:

A 22-year-old woman is diagnosed with metastatic gastric cancer, with diffuse involvement of the stomach and linitis plastica. Her father died of the same cancer at age 42 years. Her mother is concerned about familial gastric cancer and is asking for information about hereditary gastric cancer and appropriate screening for her other children. Which of the following would be the most appropriate recommendation to this family?

options.label: A
options.text: Hereditary gastric cancer is rare and unlikely. She may just have some environmental exposures or DNA mismatch repair gene mutations that cannot be screened for.

options.label: B
options.text: She may very well have hereditary early-onset diffuse gastric cancer, but no surveillance or workup is recommended because this has yet to be confirmed in larger studies.

options.label: C
options.text: E-cadherin mutation testing should be considered here, and, in fact, prophylactic gastrectomy should be considered strongly for her siblings if a germ line E-cadherin mutation is confirmed and mucosal abnormality can be documented by endoscopic examination of the stomach.

options.label: D
options.text: E-cadherin mutation testing should be considered, and, in fact, prophylactic gastrectomy should be considered strongly for her siblings if a germ line E-cadherin mutation is confirmed even if no mucosal abnormalities are seen by endoscopic examination of the stomach

questions.correct_answer: D. E-cadherin mutation testing should be considered, and, in fact, prophylactic gastrectomy should be considered strongly for her siblings if a germ line E-cadherin mutation is confirmed even if no mucosal abnormalities are seen by endoscopic examination of the stomach

questions.text: Surgery for undescended testis is recommended at what age?

Contraindications of laparoscopic cholecystectomy is

A 30 years old primigravida with 32 weeks of gestation with microcytic hypochromic anaemia of 6 gm%. She is hemodynamically stable but has history of easy fatiguability for 4-5 months. She is also giving history of passage of worms in stool. What should be the best line of management in her?

A 35 years old G2P1L1 has 24 weeks of gestation. She is a known case of rheumatic heart disease with history of valve replacement surgery done 10 years back for which she is on oral anti-coagulant therapy. Her PT (INR) is 2.0. What is the next best plan of action regarding her anticoagulation?

options.label: A
options.text: Continue oral anti coagulation till active labour

options.label: B
options.text: Switch over to inj. Heparin immediately

options.label: C
options.text: Switch over to inj. Heparin at 36 weeks

options.label: D
options.text: Give vitamin k since this is overdosage of oral anticoagulation

questions.correct_answer: C. Switch over to inj. Heparin at 36 weeks

questions.text: Which one of the following is incorrect regarding diabetes in pregnancy?

options.label: A
options.text: Oral hypo-glycaemic agents are not given in overt dm

options.label: B
options.text: GDM patients have high risk of CVS anomalies in the foetus

options.label: C
options.text: Macrosomia is seen in diabetic vasculopathy

questions.text: A 32 years old primigravida with 16 weeks of gestation has come for routine ANC visit. On ultrasound, the cervical length was found to be 2.1cm. What should be the next best plan for this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Tell her that there is a risk of second trimester abortion and do cervical cerclage

options.label: C
options.text: Do cerclage and give progesterone injections weekly

options.label: D
options.text: Do monthly USG for cervical length but there is no need of progesterone

questions.correct_answer: B. Give weekly progesterone injections only.

questions.text: A 23 years old primigravida, married since last 6 months has history of amenorrhoea since last 3 months. Her previous cycles were regular and monthly. She has history of profuse vaginal bleeding since last 4 hours and she has passed fleshy mass 1 hour back. On examination, her uterus is 8 weeks sized, cervical internal os is open. What is the likely diagnosis?
A 32 years old nulliparous patient had history of 3 abortions in last 3 years. All her abortions were spontaneous and were of 8-9 weeks. What is the possible cause amongst the following?

options.label: C
options.text: Balanced translocation in patient and partner

questions.correct_answer: C. Balanced translocation in patient and partner

questions.text: A 25 years old primigravida with tubal ectopic pregnancy of 6 weeks was subjected to single dose therapy (medical management). Her b-HCG value is 2500 IU/L. After three days of methotrexate injection, her b-HCG is 3250 IU/L. What is the next best line of management?

options.label: B
options.text: Repeat the b-HCG test after 3 days

questions.correct_answer: B. Repeat the b-HCG test after 3 days

questions.text: A 32 years old G2P1L1 with 29 weeks of gestation has IUGR with baby weight 7th percentile for that gestational age. Her bp is 140/90 since last 2 weeks. Her NST is reactive and AFI is 8cm. USG doppler is suggestive of s/d ratio of 3.8 in umbilical artery. What should be the best line of management for her?

options.label: A
options.text: Continue pregnancy, give steroids and start tab. Labetolol 100 mg bd

options.label: B
options.text: Continue pregnancy, give steroids but there is no need of anti-hypertensive at present

options.label: C
options.text: Induction of labour after steroids since there is fetoplacental insufficiency

options.label: D
options.text: Do LSCS after completion of steroids

questions.correct_answer: B. Continue pregnancy, give steroids but there is no need of anti-hypertensive at present

questions.text: Which one of the following is not a component of Tennessee classification for HELLP syndrome?
One of the following is not the clinical feature of abruptio placenta?

options.label: A
options.text: It is more common in hypertensive patients

options.label: B
options.text: It is more common in smokers

options.label: C
options.text: USG is diagnostic in most cases

options.label: D
options.text: PV examination can be done in abruptio placenta

questions.correct_answer: C. USG is diagnostic in most cases

questions.text: One of the following is not associated with placenta previa:
One of the following is not true regarding hormones in pregnancy:

options.label: A
options.text: Progesterone production is not dependent on foetus

options.label: B
options.text: Estriol formation requires raw material from fetal origin

options.label: D
options.text: HPL is directly proportional to the size of placenta

questions.text: One of the following is not correct regarding pregnancy with twin gestation?

options.label: A
options.text: Termination of monochorionic monoamniotic is by caesarean section

options.label: B
options.text: Calorie intake of patient with twins should be 300 kcal /day more than singleton pregnancy

options.label: C
options.text: Laser ablation is needed in stage2-4 of Quintero classification for TTTS

options.label: D
options.text: Pregnancy with transverse- cephalic presentation should be managed by internal podalic version

questions.correct_answer: D. Pregnancy with transverse- cephalic presentation should be managed by internal podalic version

questions.text: A 32 years old G3P2L2 with full term pregnancy has idiopathic polyhydramnios with spontaneous rupture of membranes. On examination, patient is in labour, FHS is 136 per minute, cervix is 2cm dilated with pulsatile fetal cord felt in vagina. Which of the following is not correct in the treatment of this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: Give head low position and fill the bladder with normal saline

options.label: C
options.text: Prepare the patient for cesarean section

options.label: D
options.text: Always check the FHR in O.T. before starting cesarean section

questions.correct_answer: A. Reposit the cord in uterus

questions.text: Which of the following is not a correct match?

options.label: A
options.text: Lovset manoeuvre- extended arm during breech delivery

options.label: B
options.text: Pinard manoeuvre- extended legs during breech delivery

options.label: C
options.text: Prague manoeuvre- after coming head with dorso anterior position

options.label: D
options.text: Zavanelli manoeuvre- for entrapped head during breech delivery

questions.correct_answer: C. Prague manoeuvre- after coming head with dorso anterior position

questions.text: During the embryological development in female fetus, one of the following is incorrect?

options.label: A
options.text: Hydatid of Morgagni is Mullerian structure

options.label: C
options.text: Fusion if Mullerian duct is from cranial end to caudal end

options.label: D
options.text: Estrogen is not necessary for the appearance of Mullerian ducts

questions.correct_answer: C. Fusion if Mullerian duct is from cranial end to caudal end

questions.text: In the development of genital organs, one of the following is true?

options.label: A
options.text: Turner’s syndrome is responsible for infantile uterus, streak ovaries and mental retardation

options.label: B
options.text: MRKH syndrome has poor secondary sexual characters

options.label: C
options.text: Complete AIS is responsible for ambiguous genitalia with male karyotype

options.label: D
options.text: Swyer syndrome is genotypically male with dysgenetic gonads and infantile uterus

questions.correct_answer: D. Swyer syndrome is genotypically male with dysgenetic gonads and infantile uterus

questions.text: A 20 years old female has come with history of primary amenorrhoea, with normal secondary sexual characters and USG pelvis showing normal sized uterus, vagina and ovaries. Her FSH levels are 5IU/L. Which one of the following is a possible cause?

A 23 years old multiparous woman has come to OPD with history of amenorrhoea since delivery which happened 2 years back which was complicated by PPH, she stopped breast feeding 4 months back but she has not yet got her menses. She has history of tuberculosis of lungs in past. Her UPT is negative, PRL levels are 15 ng/ml. Sr. FSH levels are 2 IU/L. Which of the following is least likely diagnosis?
A person died after consuming a large quantity of linseed seed. What is the possible cause of death.

A 7 years old girl has come to the OPD with history of premenarchal vaginal bleeding since last 1 day. Her tanner staging for breasts and pubic hair is tanner 1. Which one of the following is not the possible cause?

A neurologist refers his patient to a competent gastroenterologist for treatment of gastric ulcer. The gastroenterologist was negligent in treating this patient. Patient files a case of negligence against neurologist and gastroenterologist. Which amongst the following is true:-

options.label: A
options.text: Only the neurologist is guilty of negligence

options.label: B
options.text: Only the gastroenterologist is guilty of negligence

options.label: C
options.text: Both the neurologist and gastroenterologist are guilty of negligence

options.label: D
options.text: Information given in question is not sufficient to decide negligence

questions.correct_answer: B. Only the gastroenterologist is guilty of negligence

questions.text: A 52 years old post-menopausal patient has history of hot flushes since menopause which happened 1 year back. Which one of the following drugs is not suitable for this patient?
Which amongst the following is a test used to detect gunshot residues
Which one of the following is not the minimum criteria for diagnosis of PID?

options.label: D
options.text: Positive lab findings of cervical chlamydia or Neisseria

questions.correct_answer: D. Positive lab findings of cervical chlamydia or Neisseria

questions.text: One of the following is not true regarding active genital tb in a young patient with infertility?

options.label: A
options.text: Tubal patency test of choice is HSG

options.label: B
options.text: ATT is to be continued even if she becomes pregnant

options.label: C
options.text: IVF is the treatment of choice for multiple blocks in fallopian tube after treatment with ATT

options.label: D
options.text: Salpingectomy or cornual clipping is done in a case of tubal block with hydrosalpinx after treatment with ATT before doing IVF

questions.correct_answer: A. Tubal patency test of choice is HSG

questions.text: Identify the injury

A 36 years old multiparous patient has come with history of fishy foul-smelling vaginal discharge which is white in colour since last 7 days. Her last menstrual period was 15 days back. She has no itching or redness. Her pH of vagina is 4.8. On wet mount preparation, the vaginal epithelial cells are seen with irregular margins. Which of the following is incorrect regarding the condition?

options.label: A
options.text: It is due to g. Vaginalis most commonly

options.label: C
options.text: It is more in those patients who have STI

options.label: D
options.text: Partner is given one tab. Secnidazole 2gm.

questions.correct_answer: D. Partner is given one tab. Secnidazole 2gm.

questions.text: Algolagnia is a term used for

A 23 years old nulligravida has an ovarian tumour of 12 cm in left ovary. Her tumour marker sr. LDH is highly raised with USG showing markers of malignant changes with increased vascularity. On staging laparotomy, it was found that the tumour was stage 1c. Which of the following is not the correct treatment in this case?

options.label: D
options.text: Follow up every 3 months with pelvic exam and tumour marker evaluation

questions.text: A 28-year-old male has multiple grouped papulovesicles, on both elbows, knees, buttocks, upper back associate with severe itching. The most likely diagnosis is:
A patient comes with a red rash on the face as shown. There is no systemic complaints and reports increase of lesions after sun exposure. Pick the false statement
A patient presents with fever, chills and hypotension. He also developed headache. He developed a petechial eruption as shown. The diagnosis is:
Lichenification is most appropriately

options.label: B
options.text: Result of chronic rubbing and scratching

options.label: C
options.text: Associated with acute exacerbations of eczemas

questions.correct_answer: B. Result of chronic rubbing and scratching

questions.text: A 7 year old boy presents with appearance of multiple vesicles which enlarged to form flaccid bullae which had purulent contents. When they ruptured they left behind brown crusting. The most likely cause of the disease is:

options.label: C
options.text: Linear deposition of IgA at the dermoepidermal junction

questions.text: 40 yr old female presents in ENT OPD complaining of nasal obstruction and presence of crusts, mucopurulent rhinorrhea and breathing difficulties since last month. On examination foul smelling black crust was seen in nasal cavity. Which of the following finding can be associated with merciful anosmia?

A patient with a history of bilateral profound sensorineural hearing loss, lack of vestibular function, and progressive retinal deterioration is scheduled for an audiological assessment.Which etiology is consistent with the patient’s history?
Identify the procedure shown in Photograph

options.label: B
options.text: Testing vestibulo-ocular reflex by injecting cold water

options.label: C
options.text: Syringing of the ear in a patient with CSOM

questions.correct_answer: B. Testing vestibulo-ocular reflex by injecting cold water

questions.text: A patient presents with bleeding from the ear pain tinnitus and progressive deafness. On examination, there is a red swelling behind the intact tympanic membrane which blanches on pressure with pneumatic speculum. Management includes all except:
Pediatric patients are generally fit with which of the following?

A 72 year adult Chinese patient presenting with right side hearing loss has been subjected to audiological investigations and diagnosed to be a case of right sided serous otitis media. What will be the priority in further management of this patient?
Choose the most appropriate indication of the drug shown below:
In carcinoma laynx patient with stridor and respiratory difficulty, tracheostomy is done at which level ?

A 52-year-old patient with a right bell palsy with moderate dysfunction with synkinesis, normal symmetry at rest with complete eye closure with maximal effort and good forehead movement, thus the House-Brachmann score is:

39-year-old male presents with a 2-month history of right throat pain. There is no significant past medical history and he is a lifelong non-smoker who drinks 20 units of alcohol per week. Examination of the neck reveals a 1 cm right level II lymph node. Examination of the oropharynx reveals the following, What is the likely diagnosis

A 25 year old male presented to OPD with dyspnea and wheezing. Chest auscultation shows bilateral ronchi. You are suspecting bronchial asthma and plan for spirometry test. Which one of the following result will help in making diagnosis of bronchial asthma?

options.label: A
options.text: Decrease in FEV1 ? 20 % after 6 minutes of exercise

options.label: B
options.text: Increase in FEV1 ? 12 % following administration of inhaled bronchodilators

options.label: C
options.text: Increase in 500 ml of FEV1 after glucocorticoids inhalation

options.label: D
options.text: Less than 20 % diurnal variation on more than 3 days a week on PEF diary

questions.correct_answer: B. Increase in FEV1 ? 12 % following administration of inhaled bronchodilators

questions.text: A 50-year man with type-2 diabetes for 5 years presents in medical emergency with sudden onset of dyspnoea at rest and orthopnoea. On examination, pulse is rapid and very weak in volume. His blood pressure is 100/70 mmHg. There are diffuse crepitations at lung bases. What is the most likely diagnosis of his conditions?
A 40-year old woman presents with sudden onset palpitations followed by polyuria. An ECG done reveals narrow QRS complex tachycardia as shown in the figure. The most likely diagnosis is:

A 42 year old woman is referred with galactorrhoea. Her periods have become irregular. She has two children who are 16 and 21 years old and has been more stressed at work than previously. She is not on any regular medication. Blood tests reveal a prolactin level of 570 ng/mL. What is the most appropriate treatment?
A patient of type 2 diabetes on oral anti diabetes agents skipped his meals and checked blood glucose which comes out to be 54 mg/dl. Which of the following neuroglycopenic symptom he will manifest ?

A 60-year-old woman develops angina and will need a coronary angiogram for evaluation of coronary artery disease. She has a creatinine of 2.2 mg/dl. Which of the following is the most effective in reducing the risk of contrast-induced nephropathy?

options.label: A
options.text: Administer mannitol immediately after the contrast is given.

options.label: B
options.text: Perform prophylactic hemodialysis after the procedure.

options.label: C
options.text: Give IV hydration with normal saline or sodium bicarbonate prior to and following the procedure.

options.label: D
options.text: Dopamine infusion before and after the procedure.

questions.correct_answer: C. Give IV hydration with normal saline or sodium bicarbonate prior to and following the procedure.

questions.text: A 25-year-old man complaint of brief reddening of the urine at the time of a recent respiratory infection. The gross hematuria resolved, but his physician found microscopic hematuria on two subsequent first-voided morning urine specimens. The patient is otherwise healthy; he does not smoke. His blood pressure is 114/72 and the physical examination is normal. The urinalysis shows 2+ protein and 10 to 15 RBC/hpf, with some dysmorphic erythrocytes. No WBC or casts are seen. What is the most likely cause of his hematuria?

A 56-year-old man presents with hypertension and peripheral edema. Family history reveals that his father and a brother have kidney disease. Physical examination reveals BP 160/100.Bilateral flank masses are palpable. Urinalysis shows 15 to 20 RBC/hpf and trace protein; his serum creatinine is 3.0 mg/dL. Which will be the most likely cause of mortality in this patient

A 60-year-old man alcoholic with a 50-pack-year history of smoking presents to the emergency room with fatigue and confusion. Physical examination reveals a blood pressure of 110/70 with no orthostatic change. Hydration is adequate, heart, lung, and abdominal examinations are normal and there is no pedal edema. Laboratory data are as follows: Na: 110 mEq/L K: 3.7 mEq/L Cl: 82 mEq/L HCO3: 20 mEq/L Glucose: 100 mg/dL BUN: 5 mg/dL Creatinine: 0.7 mg/dL Urinalysis: Urine specific gravity: 1.016 Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 55-year-old man is being evaluated for constipation. There is no history of prior gastrectomy or of upper GI symptoms. Hemoglobin is 10 g/dL, mean corpuscular volume (MCV) is 72 fL, serum iron is 4 ?g/dL(normal 50-150 ?g/dL), iron-binding capacity is 450 ?g/dL(normal 250-370 ?g/dL), saturation is 1% (normal 20%-45%), and ferritin is 10 ?g/L(normal 15-400 ?g/L). Which of the following is the best next step in the evaluation of this patient’s anemia?

A 38-year-old woman presents with a 3-day history of fever and confusion. She was previously healthy and is taking no medications. She has not had diarrhea or rectal bleeding. She has a temperature of 38°C (100.4°F) and a blood pressure of 145/85. Except for confusion the neurological examination is normal. Her laboratory studies reveal the following: Hemoglobin: 8.7 g/dL Platelet count: 25,000/?L Peripheral smear: numerous fragmented RBCs, few platelets LDH: 562 IU/L (normal < 180) Creatinine: 2.7 mg/dL Liver enzymes: normal, Prothrombin time/PTT/fibrinogen levels: normal What is the most likely pathogenesis of her condition?

options.label: C
options.text: Failure to cleave von Willebrand factor multimers

questions.correct_answer: C. Failure to cleave von Willebrand factor multimers

questions.text: A 30-year-old man complains of unilateral headaches. The headaches start with a stabbing pain just below the right eye. Usually the affected eye feels “irritated” (reddened with increased lacrimation). Each pain lasts from 60 to 90 minutes, but he c/o several discrete episodes each day. The neurological examination, including cranial nerve examination, is now normal. What is your best approach to treatment at this time?

options.label: C
options.text: Obtain MRI scan of the head

questions.text: A 47-year-old male consults you because of tremor, which is interfering with his work.His father has a similar tremor. He is otherwise healthy and takes no medications. On examination his vital signs are normal. Except for the tremor, his neurological examination is normal; When he holds out his arms and extends his fingers, you detect a rapid fine tremor of both hands; the tremor goes away when he rests his arms at his side. What is the best next step in the management of this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: Electromyogram and nerve conduction studies to more fully characterize the tremor

options.label: C
options.text: MRI brain focussing on basal ganglia

questions.text: A 30-year-old man complains of bilateral leg weakness and clumsiness of fine movements of the right hand. Five years ago he had an episode of transient visual loss. On physical examination, there is hyperreflexia with Babinski sign in the lower extremities and cerebellar signs with poor finger-to-nose movement on the right. When the patient is asked to look to the right, the left eye does not move normally past the midline. Nystagmus is noted in the abducting eye. A more detailed history suggests the patient has had several episodes of gait difficulty that have resolved spontaneously. He appears to be stable between these episodes. He has no systemic symptoms of fever or weight loss. Which of the following is the most appropriate next test to order?

options.label: D
options.text: Testing for oligoclonal bands in cerebrospinal fluid

questions.correct_answer: B. MR scan with gadolinium contrast

questions.text: A 50 year old female complaint of leg discomfort more in the night when she is trying to sleep and decreased by moving around. There is no other significant medical history. Iron studies, kidney functions and plasma glucose are normal. Which of the following is the best initial treatment for her?
A 55-year-old diabetic woman suddenly develops weakness of the left side of her face as well as of her right arm and leg. She also has diplopia on left lateral gaze. Where is the responsible lesion?
questions.correct_answer: D. Left side of the brainstem

questions.text: A 47-year-old man is evaluated for 1 year of recurrent episodes of bilateral ear swelling. The ear is painful during these events, and the right ear has become floppy. On examination, the left ear has a beefy red colour and the pinna is tender and swollen; the earlobe appears minimally swollen but is neither red nor tender. Which of the following is the most likely explanation for this finding?

A 30 year old female presented with dry cough and fever for 1 months. You noticed erythema nodosum on shin, lupus pernio on face, uveitis and parotid gland enlargement. Which of the following statements regarding this condition is true?

options.label: A
options.text: Skin involvement is most common manifestation.

options.label: C
options.text: Facial nerve involvement is mainly upper motor neuron type.

options.label: D
options.text: Pulmonary infiltrates tend to be predominantly an upper lobe process.

questions.correct_answer: D. Pulmonary infiltrates tend to be predominantly an upper lobe process.

questions.text: A 64-year-old woman is evaluated for weakness. She has had several weeks of difficulty brushing her teeth and combing her hair. She has also noted a rash on her face. Examination is notable for a heliotrope rash and proximal muscle weakness. Serum creatinine kinase is elevated and anti-Jo-1 antibodies are positive. She is also likely to have which of the following findings?
You are asked to distinguish jugular venous pulsation (JVP) from the arterial pulsation in neck, which of the following statement is NOT correct?

options.label: A
options.text: The height of venous pulse varies with respiration

options.label: B
options.text: Abdominal pressure causes rise in venous pulse

options.label: C
options.text: Venous pulse has a single peak in each cardiac cycle

options.label: D
options.text: Venous pulse is not easily palpable

questions.correct_answer: C. Venous pulse has a single peak in each cardiac cycle

questions.text: A patient presents with cough, dyspnea and wheezing for one month. His chest ray showed bilateral infiltrates. Blood test revealed eosinophilia. Which of the following does NOT cause pulmonary infiltrates with eosinophilia?
All of the following are features of Whipple disease except?
A 12 year male presented with deranged liver function tests and tremors. The eye examination findings are shown in the figure. Which of the following statement is true about these eye findings?

options.label: B
options.text: Seen in all cases of hepatic involvement

options.label: C
options.text: Absence of these rings excludes the diagnosis of the disease

questions.text: A 50 year old man comes with aphasia. He is unable to name things and repetition is poor. However comprehension, fluency and understanding written words is unaffected. He is probably suffering from
A known case of type 2 diabetes with hypertension comes for routine check up. ECG done is shown in the figure. Determine the mean frontal QRS axis in the given ECG
Pain on injection is seen with
A D& C has to be done as a day care procedure. Which one is best combination for this

A 4 year old child has to be operated for crushed finger under general anaesthesia. The child has taken food 3 hours back. The family has history of malignant hyperthermia. Which of the following is anaesthetic likely to use
During LSCS under spinal anaesthesia pt had fall in blood pressure. Most appropriate will be
Following is seen with

After 11 days in the intensive care unit following an automobile accident, an 18-year-old woman develops increased urinary urgency, burning during urination, and lower abdominal pain. When her urine is cultured, a typical pigment is observed in the Petri dish as shown in the image. What is the most likely organism causing these symptoms?

A 10-year-old boy presents to his pediatrician complaining of a fever and a sore throat for 2 days. Physical examination reveals the presence of purulent tonsillar exudates and swollen, tender anterior cervical nodes. Culture of the tonsillar exudate reveals gram-positive cocci. Which of the following are characteristic of the organism most likely causing this boy's infection?

A 32-year-old NRI man presents to the emergency department because of shortness of breath and palpitations. He and his family recently immigrated from Peru. X-ray of the chest demonstrates pulmonary congestion. Echocardiography reveals biventricular dilatation with massive cardiac enlargement. Endomyocardial biopsy demonstrates the presence of intracellular protozoan parasites as shown in the image. Which vector is most likely responsible for transmitting this patient's disease?

A previously healthy 6-mont h-old girl is brought to the pediatrician with a cough that has been increasing in severity for several days. Her parents worry that she is having occasional difficulty breathing. On examination, temperature is 37.4°C and oxygen saturation is 92%. Auscultation of the lungs reveals inspiratory crackles and expiratory wheezing. The pediatrician suspects the child is suffering from bronchiolitis, and this diagnosis is confirmed through serologic analysis of a nasopharyngeal swab. Which of the following describes the etiologic agent of the girl's condition?

options.label: A
options.text: It is a non-enveloped RNA virus with a double-stranded, segmented genome

options.label: B
options.text: It is a prokaryotic organism lacking a cell wall

options.label: C
options.text: It is an enveloped RNA virus with a single-stranded, non-segmented genome

options.label: D
options.text: It is an enveloped RNA virus with a single-stranded, segmented genome

questions.correct_answer: C. It is an enveloped RNA virus with a single-stranded, non-segmented genome

questions.text: The world’s first Plasmid DNA based vaccine against SARS CoV2 produced in India is

A 19-year-old college student comes to the physician with a 12-hour history of a temperature of 39°C. He also complains of headache and neck stiffness. Physical exam reveals nuchal rigidity. A smear of his cerebrospinal fluid reveals gram-negative diplococci, cultures grow on Thayer-Martin media. Medical history is significant for absence of vaccinations as a child. What symptoms can develop as a severe complication of this infection?

options.label: A
options.text: Fever, new murmur, small erythematous lesions on the palms, and splinter haemorrhages on the nail bed

options.label: D
options.text: Simultaneous ataxia, urinary incontinence, and cognitive decline

questions.text: An 18-year-old man comes to the physician complaining of a runny nose, sneezing, and difficulty breathing for the past 2 days. His medical history Is significant for cadaveric kidney transplant 2 years ago, sore throat 2 weeks ago that resolved on its own, and an allergy to latex. He says that when he goes outside or is away from his house, his symptoms improve. On physical examination his turbinates are boggy and violaceous. This type of reaction is most likely which of the following?

A 27-year-old man presents to the physician with fever~ malaise, cough, and wheezing. During the physical examination, the patient intermittently coughs up brownish-colored mucus. The rest of the physical examination is unremarkable. A chest x-ray reveals a mass within a left lung cavity. The pathology report on mucus specimens indicates infection with an identified opportunistic microorganism. Another species in this infectious agent's family can also produce a toxin that can result in hepatocellular carcinoma. What is the microscopic morphology of this agent?

options.label: A
options.text: A heavily encapsulated yeast that is not dimorphic

options.label: B
options.text: A mold with septate hyphae that branch at a V-shaped 45-degree angle

options.label: C
options.text: A mold with irregular non-septate hyphae branching at wide angles

options.label: D
options.text: Cigar-shaped budding yeast visible in pus

questions.correct_answer: B. A mold with septate hyphae that branch at a V-shaped 45-degree angle

questions.text: Choose the appropriate medium from the list used for the cultivation of a fastidious pathogen.

An 12-year-old boy is taken to his pediatrician because his mother noticed a raised, scaly area on the back of his head. He examines the boy’s scalp with a Wood’s lamp, He does not notice fluorescence. He collects scrapings of the area. No organisms are seen on microscopic examination, but a mold grows on Sabouraud dextrose agar (SDA). Numerous microconidia but no macroconidia are seen on microscopic examination as shown in the picture. Which organism is most likely responsible for this patient 's infection?
An abdominal CT in a 50-year-old patient with Conn syndrome shows multiple small adrenocortical masses. Which of the following clinical findings are likely to be present in this patient?

options.label: D
options.text: Increased concentrating ability of the kidney

questions.text: A 50-year-old male presents to the doctor for a 6-month check-up following diuretic therapy and recommended dietary changes for his essential hypertension. His bp is 140/95 mm Hg. His serum aldosterone is elevated. Aldosterone secretion is increased due to a decrease in which of the following in this patient?

A patient undergoes cardiac transplantation for severe idiopathic cardiomyopathy. Post-surgery the patient undergoes a cardiac rehabilitation programme in which he is started on a walking regimen. In cardiac transplant patients, increase in stroke volume during exercise occurs mainly by which of the following mechanisms?
Twenty years ago, a 65-year-old man underwent vagotomy for his refractory peptic ulcer disease. As a result, which of the following gastrointestinal motor activities will be affected most?

A scientist doing experiments with sodium cyanide started experiencing headache, dizziness, clumsiness, decreased visual acuity, nausea. He was taken to the Emergency. Blood values obtained while he was breathing room air were as follows: Hb: 16 g/dL Pao2: 102 mm Hg Sao2: 97.5% Paco2: 27 mm Hg Pvo2: 65 mm Hg Svo2: 90% pH: 7.57 [HCO3-]: 23mEq/L Cardiac output: 5.6L/min Hypoxia in this patient is likely due to which of the following?

options.label: B
options.text: Impaired diffusion across the respiratory membrane

options.label: C
options.text: Impaired oxygen utilization by the tissues

options.label: D
options.text: Impaired oxygen delivery to the tissues

questions.correct_answer: C. Impaired oxygen utilization by the tissues

questions.text: Sorghum causes pellagra due to the presence of:
Enzyme deficient in phenyl ketonuria is :
Which among the following amino acids absorbs UV light?
The concept of Lac operon was first described by Francois Jacob and Jacques Monod in E.coli. CAP in Lac operon is an example of :
Which vitamin deficiency can result in Homocystinuria?
During replantation of an amputated limb which of the following is done first :
What happens to angle A and B in fracture calcaneum?
A previously healthy 45 years old labourer suddenly develops acute lower back pain with right-leg pain and weakness of dorsiflexion of the right great toe. Which of the following is true:

options.label: A
options.text: Immediate treatment should include analgesics muscle relaxants and back strengthening exercises.

options.label: B
options.text: The appearance of the foot drop indicate early surgical intervention.

options.label: C
options.text: If the neurological sign resolve with in 2–3 weeks but lowback pain persists, the proper treatment would include fusion of affected lumbar vertebra.

options.label: D
options.text: If the neurological signs fail to resolve within 1 week,lumbar laminectomy and excision of any herniated nucleus pulposus should be done.

questions.correct_answer: B. The appearance of the foot drop indicate early surgical intervention.

questions.text: All of the following features can be observed after the injury to axillary nerve, except:

options.label: A
options.text: Loss of rounded contour of shoulder

options.label: B
options.text: Loss of sensation along lateral side of upper arm

questions.text: An 8 year old boy presents with Right Hip Pain and Limping Gait for last one week. The mothers gives history of recent URTI in last month only. The examination revealed limitation of hip movements only in extremes. Blood counts are almost normal except Raised ESR. What is the diagnosis ?
